trans-unit.source: The Azure CLI and API Apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: The Azure CLI and API Apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to use the Microsoft Azure Command-line Interface (CLI) for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure API Apps.
trans-unit.target: How to use the Microsoft Azure Command-line Interface (CLI) for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure API Apps.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Command-line Interface (CLI) and API apps
trans-unit.target: The Azure Command-line Interface (CLI) and API apps

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to create, manage, and delete API apps in Azure App Service, using the Azure Command-Line Interface (CLI) for Mac, Linux, and Windows.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to create, manage, and delete API apps in Azure App Service, using the Azure Command-Line Interface (CLI) for Mac, Linux, and Windows.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This article assumes you have installed the Azure CLI and know how to perform basic tasks.
trans-unit.target: This article assumes you have installed the Azure CLI and know how to perform basic tasks.

trans-unit.source: For an introduction to the CLI, see <link><linkText>Install and Configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For an introduction to the CLI, see <link><linkText>Install and Configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The instructions for connecting to an Azure subscription offer two alternatives: log in using a work or school account, and download a .publishsettings file.
trans-unit.target: The instructions for connecting to an Azure subscription offer two alternatives: log in using a work or school account, and download a .publishsettings file.

trans-unit.source: For API apps, the .publishsettings file authentication method will not work.
trans-unit.target: For API apps, the .publishsettings file authentication method will not work.

trans-unit.source: This is because you have to use Resource Management mode (introduced in the next section) to work with API apps, and the .publishsettings file authentication method doesn't work with Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: This is because you have to use Resource Management mode (introduced in the next section) to work with API apps, and the .publishsettings file authentication method doesn't work with Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: Enable Resource Management mode
trans-unit.target: Enable Resource Management mode

trans-unit.source: The CLI can be used in <link><linkText>Service Management (asm)</linkText><title></title></link> mode or <link><linkText>Resource Management (arm)</linkText><title></title></link> mode.
trans-unit.target: The CLI can be used in <link><linkText>Service Management (asm)</linkText><title></title></link> mode or <link><linkText>Resource Management (arm)</linkText><title></title></link> mode.

trans-unit.source: For API apps you have to use Resource Management mode.
trans-unit.target: For API apps you have to use Resource Management mode.

trans-unit.source: Because arm mode is not enabled by default, use the config mode arm command to enable it.
trans-unit.target: Because arm mode is not enabled by default, use the config mode arm command to enable it.

trans-unit.source: List commands available for working with API apps
trans-unit.target: List commands available for working with API apps

trans-unit.source: To see all the commands currently available for working with API apps, run the apiapp command.
trans-unit.target: To see all the commands currently available for working with API apps, run the apiapp command.

trans-unit.source: List all API apps in a subscription or resource group
trans-unit.target: List all API apps in a subscription or resource group

trans-unit.source: To list all the API apps you have in your subscription, run the apiapp list command with no parameters.
trans-unit.target: To list all the API apps you have in your subscription, run the apiapp list command with no parameters.

trans-unit.source: The list shows the resource group, API app name, package ID, and URL of each API app.
trans-unit.target: The list shows the resource group, API app name, package ID, and URL of each API app.

trans-unit.source: To limit the list to a specified resource group, add the group (-g) parameter.
trans-unit.target: To limit the list to a specified resource group, add the group (-g) parameter.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: To add API app version and access level information to the list, add the details (-d) parameter.
trans-unit.target: To add API app version and access level information to the list, add the details (-d) parameter.

trans-unit.source: The list output with the additional fields looks like this example:
trans-unit.target: The list output with the additional fields looks like this example:

trans-unit.source: List details about an API app
trans-unit.target: List details about an API app

trans-unit.source: To list details for one API app, use the apiapp show command with the group (-g) and API app name (-n) parameters.
trans-unit.target: To list details for one API app, use the apiapp show command with the group (-g) and API app name (-n) parameters.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The output looks like this:
trans-unit.target: The output looks like this:

trans-unit.source: Create an API app
trans-unit.target: Create an API app

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to create an API app.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to create an API app.

trans-unit.source: You can use imperative CLI commands to create Azure resources individually, or you can use declarative syntax in a template to define all of the required resources together and deploy that template with a CLI command.
trans-unit.target: You can use imperative CLI commands to create Azure resources individually, or you can use declarative syntax in a template to define all of the required resources together and deploy that template with a CLI command.

trans-unit.source: For the declarative approach, see <link><linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the declarative approach, see <link><linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To create an API app using the imperative approach, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create an API app using the imperative approach, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Choose a valid location
trans-unit.target: Choose a valid location

trans-unit.source: Create or find a resource group to use
trans-unit.target: Create or find a resource group to use

trans-unit.source: Create or find an App Service plan to use
trans-unit.target: Create or find an App Service plan to use

trans-unit.source: Create the API app
trans-unit.target: Create the API app

trans-unit.source: Choose a valid location
trans-unit.target: Choose a valid location

trans-unit.source: When you create a resource group, you need to specify a location.
trans-unit.target: When you create a resource group, you need to specify a location.

trans-unit.source: Here are some of the locations that are valid for API apps.
trans-unit.target: Here are some of the locations that are valid for API apps.

trans-unit.source: East US
trans-unit.target: East US

trans-unit.source: West US
trans-unit.target: West US

trans-unit.source: South Central US
trans-unit.target: South Central US

trans-unit.source: North Europe
trans-unit.target: North Europe

trans-unit.source: East Asia
trans-unit.target: East Asia

trans-unit.source: Japan East
trans-unit.target: Japan East

trans-unit.source: West Europe
trans-unit.target: West Europe

trans-unit.source: Southeast Asia
trans-unit.target: Southeast Asia

trans-unit.source: Japan West
trans-unit.target: Japan West

trans-unit.source: North Central US
trans-unit.target: North Central US

trans-unit.source: Central US
trans-unit.target: Central US

trans-unit.source: Brazil South
trans-unit.target: Brazil South

trans-unit.source: East US 2
trans-unit.target: East US 2

trans-unit.source: To get a complete and up-to-date list of locations, use the location list command, and see the Microsoft.AppService/apiapps resource provider line.
trans-unit.target: To get a complete and up-to-date list of locations, use the location list command, and see the Microsoft.AppService/apiapps resource provider line.

trans-unit.source: Here is sample output from the location list command.
trans-unit.target: Here is sample output from the location list command.

trans-unit.source: Create or find a resource group to use
trans-unit.target: Create or find a resource group to use

trans-unit.source: To create a resource group use the group create command with the name (n) and location (l) parameters.
trans-unit.target: To create a resource group use the group create command with the name (n) and location (l) parameters.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: To find an existing resource group, use the group list command, and choose a resource group in a location valid for API apps.
trans-unit.target: To find an existing resource group, use the group list command, and choose a resource group in a location valid for API apps.

trans-unit.source: Create or find an App Service plan to use
trans-unit.target: Create or find an App Service plan to use

trans-unit.source: To create an App Service plan, use the resource create command and use the resource type parameter (-r) to specify that the type of resource you want to create is an App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: To create an App Service plan, use the resource create command and use the resource type parameter (-r) to specify that the type of resource you want to create is an App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The JSON string for the properties (-p) parameter is required due to some recent changes in the REST API; in the future the -p parameter will be optional.
trans-unit.target: The JSON string for the properties (-p) parameter is required due to some recent changes in the REST API; in the future the -p parameter will be optional.

trans-unit.source: The sample command specifies the latest API version as of the date this article was written.
trans-unit.target: The sample command specifies the latest API version as of the date this article was written.

trans-unit.source: To check if a later version is available, use the provider show command and see the apiVersions array for the sites object in the resourceTypes array.
trans-unit.target: To check if a later version is available, use the provider show command and see the apiVersions array for the sites object in the resourceTypes array.

trans-unit.source: Here is a sample of the sites object in the command output.
trans-unit.target: Here is a sample of the sites object in the command output.

trans-unit.source: To list existing App Service plans, use the resource list command and specify App Service plan as the resource type by using the -r parameter.
trans-unit.target: To list existing App Service plans, use the resource list command and specify App Service plan as the resource type by using the -r parameter.

trans-unit.source: The output looks like this:
trans-unit.target: The output looks like this:

trans-unit.source: Create an empty (custom) API app
trans-unit.target: Create an empty (custom) API app

trans-unit.source: To create an empty API app (one that you will write the code for yourself), use the apiapp create command and specify the Microsoft.ApiApp Nuget package (-u parameter).
trans-unit.target: To create an empty API app (one that you will write the code for yourself), use the apiapp create command and specify the Microsoft.ApiApp Nuget package (-u parameter).

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The output reports progress as the API app is created.
trans-unit.target: The output reports progress as the API app is created.

trans-unit.source: Create an API app from the Marketplace
trans-unit.target: Create an API app from the Marketplace

trans-unit.source: To get a list of API app packages available in the Marketplace, use the group template list command and specify API apps by using the category (-c) parameter.
trans-unit.target: To get a list of API app packages available in the Marketplace, use the group template list command and specify API apps by using the category (-c) parameter.

trans-unit.source: The output looks like this example:
trans-unit.target: The output looks like this example:

trans-unit.source: To create an API app from the Marketplace use the apiapap create command and specify the name of the API app you want to create by using the NuGet package (-u) parameter.
trans-unit.target: To create an API app from the Marketplace use the apiapap create command and specify the name of the API app you want to create by using the NuGet package (-u) parameter.

trans-unit.source: The value to use for the -u parameter is the middle section of the marketplace name.
trans-unit.target: The value to use for the -u parameter is the middle section of the marketplace name.

trans-unit.source: For example, for microsoft_com.MicrosoftSqlConnector.0.2.2, the command looks like this:
trans-unit.target: For example, for microsoft_com.MicrosoftSqlConnector.0.2.2, the command looks like this:

trans-unit.source: If any API app template parameters are required, such as server names and connection strings for a SQL connector, you'll be prompted for the required data.
trans-unit.target: If any API app template parameters are required, such as server names and connection strings for a SQL connector, you'll be prompted for the required data.

trans-unit.source: You have the option to use the --parameters or --parameters-file to pass in the parameter values.
trans-unit.target: You have the option to use the --parameters or --parameters-file to pass in the parameter values.

trans-unit.source: For more information about parameters files, see <link><linkText>Provision an API app with a new gateway</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about parameters files, see <link><linkText>Provision an API app with a new gateway</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This article has shown how to use individual Azure CLI commands to work with custom API apps or API apps that you create from Marketplace templates.
trans-unit.target: This article has shown how to use individual Azure CLI commands to work with custom API apps or API apps that you create from Marketplace templates.
